DOCNAME: CASE OF ZENGİN AND ÇAKIR v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 10 - Freedom of expression-{general} (Article 10-1 - Freedom of expression)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE and live in GPE and NORP respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants participated in reading out a press statement in commemoration of PERSON , the leader of ORG ( ORG – NORP / PERSON ) , who had died in DATE , allegedly under torture in police custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE public prosecutor initiated criminal proceedings against CARDINAL people , including the applicants , charging them with disseminating propaganda in favour of the TKP / ML , under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Prevention of Terrorism Act ( Law no . ORG ) . According to the indictment , during the gathering , the second applicant had read out a press declaration containing statements praising the TKP / ML and PERSON , and the following slogans had been chanted by the demonstrators : “ PERSON is our leader ” , “ Our struggle continues and shall continue ” , “ PERSON is immortal ” , “ Down with the GPE ” and “ We will drown fascism in the blood it has shed ” . The group had also carried a banner which read “ PERSON is immortal NORP ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found the applicants guilty as charged and sentenced each of them to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of PERSON no . ORG . In its judgment , the assize court held that the applicants had disseminated propaganda in favour of the TKP / ML , given that the second applicant had read out the press statement and the first applicant had chanted slogans . The court based its judgment on a report prepared by an expert regarding a police video - recording of the public gathering in question .

CARDINAL . Taking into account the applicants’ good behaviour during the trial and the fact that they had no previous criminal convictions , the court suspended pronouncement of the applicants’ conviction on the condition that they did not commit another intentional offence for DATE , under LAW ( hükmün açıklanmasının geri bırakılması ) .

CARDINAL . The applicants filed an objection against the decision of DATE . In their petition , they stated that the first - instance court had erred in interpreting the facts and the law , and they asked to be acquitted of the charges against them . They further stated that their prosecution had constituted a breach of LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that the application of LAW in the case was in line with the domestic law , and rejected the applicants’ objection without examining the merits of the case . That decision was served on the applicants on DATE .
